@alexishinde Thanks! I bailed out of the bike lane and walked a good stretch on the sidewalk after being uncomfortable by the passing buses.
@roxannestp Good idea. Or, even just have the engineering manager go co-locate there for a snow storm. Just one.
@lazarus7 Thanks, me too. It was, in retrospect, worse than I expected.
😂 RT @gpsforthebrain: T (9): Have you ever tried sucking applesauce through a straw? Me: I can’t say that I have. T: It’s a terrible idea.
@scidhuv00 Literal scare quotes. Also allows him to weasel out of meaning of the word. “Oh, I didn’t mean _evil_, I just meant _bad dudes_”
@PortmanDoe On a road where I typically see one, maybe two cars, it was a steady, speeding stream.
@PortmanDoe It was crazy tonight. The hill I took the pic on, I was managing the road conditions but cars scared me to the sidewalk.
And the only way to avoid that is early plowing. Waiting for significant accumulation before sending out plows doesn’t do any good.
Because you know what makes the side streets so treacherous? Snow compacted down into takes-forever-to-melt rutted ice.
So stop wasting our money and go learn how other municipalities do it. Hint: contract emergency plowing to small operators.
Spoiler: not at all. Salt & brine good on frost/black ice, utterly ineffective on accumulating snow. Plow & salt/sand is necessary.
Dear CoV engineers: please go out RIGHT NOW and evaluate how effective your smug “4 days of brining and salting” has been on side streets.
Typical 22 min bike home was 75 min bike (50%), walk (40%), slide (10%) tonight. Lots of careless motoring happening. #bikeyvr

Actually quite impressed with the motorvehicles: doing about 15 kph up the hill by WPGA, about 20 kph on University Blvd.
Uneventful #bikeyvr today. Cars are taking it nice and slow, but CoV has already lost the battle -- it's compact and slick everywhere.

@castlemischief Our last govt actively suppressed scientists speaking out about climate change. However, didn’t have power to limit research
@castlemischief But having US do it at a much larger scale = global implications. Likewise ban on funding orgs remotely linked to abortions.
@castlemischief Our last government was of that sort.
@castlemischief The ability for any head of government to suppress legitimate research, in particular w/ worldwide consequences, is awful
@castlemischief And we’re all going to suffer for it too.
